title: Drawing, "Design for a Soup Tureen", ca. 1920–40
medium: Pen and black ink, green color pencil, graphite on cream tracing paper
markings: Stamp: in black ink at upper right: 67
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and black ink at lower center: SOUPIERE; in graphite; A; in black ink: LONGUEUR; 36 cms/HAUTEUR TOTALE: 24 cms; at lower right: JEAN PUIFORCAT/3.14; to right of lid handle: [arrow pointing left] onyx; to right of cover: [arrow pointing left downward] OVERTURE
creditline: Gift of John Finguerra in memory of his brother Jim Finguerra
description:
Bulbous shaped tureen drawn in elevation with a rounded lid surmounted by two arched handles, indicated in green color pencil to be executed in onyx (see plan) flanked by thin rectangular handles each with two cut-out fingerholes (see plan) raised in a circular reeded base with a central applied molding ending in a molded foot rim. Underdrawing in graphite of tureen in golden section.
Plan of soup tureen in Puiforcat collection (1995-164-32).
Puiforcat Fabrication #: 67.
